Class Comment

java.lang.Object
  Comment

public class Comment
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a comment left for a sales item on an online sales site. A comment consists of a comment text, a rating, and an author name. Other users can indicate whether the comment was useful or not (called 'upvoting' or 'downvoting'). The balance between upvotes and downvotes is stored with comments. A negative vote balance means that the comment received more downvotes than upvotes.

Version:
2011-07-31

Constructor Detail

Comment

public Comment(java.lang.String author,
               java.lang.String text,
               int rating)
Create a comment with all necessary details. The initial vote balance is 0.

Method Detail

downvote

public void downvote()
Indicate that this comment is not useful ('downvote'). This is used when a reader clicks the 'No' button after the "Was this comment helpful?" quesion.

getAuthor

public java.lang.String getAuthor()
Return the author of this comment.

getFullDetails

public java.lang.String getFullDetails()
Return the full text and details of the comment, including the comment text, author and rating.

getRating

public int getRating()
Return the rating of this comment.

getVoteCount

public int getVoteCount()
Return the vote count (balance of up and down-votes).

upvote

public void upvote()
Indicate that this comment is useful ('upvote'). This is used when a reader clicks the 'Yes' button after the "Was this comment helpful?" quesion.
